facts.1: Epiphany, also known as Three Kings' Day, is celebrated on January 6th to commemorate the visit of the Magi to the baby Jesus.
facts.2: The day is observed by many Christian denominations and is associated with various customs and traditions, including the blessing of homes and the baking of special cakes.
facts.3: Epiphany marks the end of the Christmas season and is a public holiday in many countries.

facts.1: National Bean Day celebrates the nutritional value and versatility of beans, which are a staple food in many cultures.
facts.2: Beans are rich in protein, fiber, vitamins, and minerals, making them an important part of a healthy diet.
facts.3: The day encourages people to enjoy beans in various dishes, from soups and stews to salads and casseroles.

facts.1: National Shortbread Day honors the classic Scottish cookie known for its rich, buttery flavor and crumbly texture.
facts.2: Shortbread is traditionally made with just three ingredients: butter, sugar, and flour.
facts.3: The day encourages people to bake and enjoy shortbread cookies, often shaped into rounds, fingers, or festive designs.
